definitions: To place something over or in front of (something else) in order to protect, conceal, or close it.
To deal with (a subject) by describing or analyzing it.
To provide financial protection for (someone or something).
To aim a gun at (someone or something).
examples: She used a blanket to cover the sleeping child.
The report will cover various aspects of the economy.
They covered a lot of ground on their hike.
Does your insurance cover dental expenses?
The police officer told him to cover the suspect.
